who is the current ceo of microsoft: The current CEO of Microsoft is Satya Nadella
who is the owner of apple: The owner of Apple is Tim Cook
who is the owner of google: The owner of Google is Sundar Pichai
who is the owner of microsoft: The owner of Microsoft is Satya Nadella
who invented car: The automobile was invented by Karl Benz in 1886.
who invented telephone: The telephone was invented by Alexander Graham Bell in 1876.
who invented mobile: The mobile phone was invented by Martin Cooper, a Motorola engineer, in 1973.
who invented python: Python was invented by Guido van Rossum and first released in 1991.
who invented india: India was not invented by a single person; it has a rich history shaped by various civilizations and cultures over thousands of years.
name the capital of andhra pradesh: The capital of Andhra Pradesh is Amaravati.
name the capital of telangana: The capital of Telangana is Hyderabad.
name the capital of madhya pradesh: The capital of Madhya Pradesh is Bhopal.
name the capital of haryana: The capital of Haryana is Chandigarh.
name the capital of assam: The capital of Assam is Dispur.
name the capital of jharkhand: The capital of Jharkhand is Ranchi.
name the capital of himachal pradesh: The capital of Himachal Pradesh is Shimla.
name the capital of uttar pradesh: The capital of Uttar Pradesh is Lucknow.
name the capital of rajasthan: The capital of Rajasthan is Jaipur.
name the capital of kerala: The capital of Kerala is Thiruvananthapuram.
name the capital of tamil nadu: The capital of Tamil Nadu is Chennai.
name the capital of karnataka: The capital of Karnataka is Bengaluru.
name the capital of maharashtra: The capital of Maharashtra is Mumbai.
name the capital of gujarat: The capital of Gujarat is Gandhinagar.
name the capital of punjab: The capital of Punjab is Chandigarh.
name the capital of west bengal: The capital of West Bengal is Kolkata.
name the capital of bihar: The capital of Bihar is Patna.
name the capitals of india: Some capitals of Indian states are: Andhra Pradesh - Amaravati, Bihar - Patna, West Bengal - Kolkata, Odisha - Bhubaneswar, Madhya Pradesh - Bhopal, Haryana - Chandigarh, Assam - Dispur, Jharkhand - Ranchi, Telangana - Hyderabad, Chhattisgarh - Raipur.
name the states of india: India has 28 states: Andhra Pradesh, Arunachal Pradesh, Assam, Bihar, Chhattisgarh, Goa, Gujarat, Haryana, Himachal Pradesh, Jharkhand, Karnataka, Kerala, Madhya Pradesh, Maharashtra, Manipur, Meghalaya, Mizoram, Nagaland, Odisha, Punjab, Rajasthan, Sikkim, Tamil Nadu, Telangana, Tripura, Uttar Pradesh, Uttarakhand, West Bengal.
what is the capital of india: The capital of India is New Delhi.
what is the capital of france: The capital of France is Paris.
largest planet in solar system: The largest planet in our solar system is Jupiter.
largest star in the universe: The largest known star in the universe is UY Scuti, a red supergiant star located in the constellation Scutum.
name of plannts in solar system: The names of the planets in our solar system are Mercury, Venus, Earth, Mars, Jupiter, Saturn, Uranus, and Neptune.
what is the name of our galaxy: The name of our galaxy is the Milky Way.
what is c++: C++ is a high-level programming language that is an extension of the C programming language, known for its object-oriented features.
why are you here: I am here to assist you with your questions and provide information on various topics.
what is earth: Earth is the third planet from the Sun in our solar system and the only known planet to support life.
what is your work: I am a lock assistant created to help answer your questions and provide information on various topics.
how are you?: I am just a program, so I don't have feelings, but thanks for asking!
what is ai?: AI stands for Artificial Intelligence, which refers to the simulation of human intelligence in machines that are programmed to think and learn.
who created you?: I was created by Ayush as an industrial training project.
how old are you?: I don't have an age like humans do, as I am a computer program created to assist you.
how do you work?: I work by processing your questions and providing answers based on my programming and the data I have been trained on.
how to help you?: You can help me by asking clear and specific questions so I can provide the best possible answers.
how to use you?: You can use me by typing or speaking your questions, and I will do my best to provide accurate and helpful responses.
how to talk to you?: You can talk to me by typing your questions or using voice commands if supported.
how to ask questions?: You can ask questions by typing them out clearly or speaking them if voice input is available.
how do u feel?: I don't have feelings, but I'm here to help you with any questions you have!
what do u think about me?: I don't have personal opinions, but I'm here to assist you with any questions or information you need.
what is your purpose?: My purpose is to assist you by providing information and answering your questions to the best of my ability.
what can you do?: I can answer questions, provide information on various topics, and help with tasks like programming, general knowledge, and more.
what do u think about ai?: AI is a fascinating field that has the potential to greatly enhance our lives by automating tasks, providing insights, and enabling new technologies.
on which date u were created?: I was created as an industrial training project, but I don't have a specific creation date like a human would.
what is hinduism?: A major world religion originating in India, characterized by a variety of beliefs and practices. Example: Hinduism includes worship of deities like Vishnu and Shiva.
who is brahma?: The creator god in Hinduism, part of the Trimurti. Example: Brahma created the universe and all living beings.
who is vishnu?: The preserver god in Hinduism, part of the Trimurti. Example: Vishnu incarnates as avatars like Rama and Krishna to protect dharma.
what is atman?: The individual soul or self. Example: Atman is eternal and part of the universal Brahman.
what is brahman?: The ultimate reality or universal consciousness. Example: Brahman is beyond all forms and attributes.
what is yoga?: A spiritual and physical discipline for union with the divine. Example: Yoga includes practices like asanas, meditation, and breath control.
what is dharma?: The moral and ethical duties in life. Example: Following one's dharma leads to harmony and balance.
what is reincarnation?: The cycle of birth, death, and rebirth. Example: A soul is reborn in different bodies based on karma.
what is puja?: A ritual worship of deities. Example: Puja involves offerings, prayers, and chanting.
what is meditation?: A practice of focused concentration to achieve mental clarity and spiritual insight. Example: Meditation helps calm the mind and connect with the inner self.
what is karma?: The law of cause and effect, where actions have consequences. Example: Good karma leads to positive outcomes, while bad karma leads to suffering.
what is moksha?: The liberation from the cycle of reincarnation. Example: Moksha is achieved through self-realization and union with Brahman.
what are the vedas?: Ancient sacred texts of Hinduism. Example: The Vedas contain hymns, rituals, and philosophical teachings.
what is the bhagavad gita?: A sacred Hindu scripture that is part of the Mahabharata. Example: The Bhagavad Gita presents a dialogue between Prince Arjuna and Lord Krishna on duty and spirituality.
who is ganesha?: The elephant-headed god of wisdom and remover of obstacles. Example: Ganesha is worshipped at the beginning of new ventures for success.
who is lakshmi?: The goddess of wealth, prosperity, and fortune. Example: Lakshmi is often depicted with gold coins and lotus flowers.
who is saraswati?: The goddess of knowledge, music, and arts. Example: Saraswati is depicted with a veena and a book, symbolizing learning and creativity.
what is a mantra?: A sacred sound or phrase repeated during meditation or rituals. Example: The mantra 'Om' is considered the primordial sound of the universe.
who is krishna?: An avatar of Vishnu and a central figure in Hinduism. Example: Krishna is known for his teachings in the Bhagavad Gita and his playful childhood stories.
who is rama?: An avatar of Vishnu and the hero of the Ramayana. Example: Rama is revered for his righteousness and devotion to dharma.
who is shiva?: The destroyer god in Hinduism, part of the Trimurti. Example: Shiva performs the cosmic dance of destruction and regeneration.
what is tantra?: A spiritual tradition that emphasizes rituals, meditation, and esoteric practices. Example: Tantra includes the use of mantras, yantras, and meditation techniques to achieve spiritual growth.
names of shiva?: Some names of Shiva include Mahadeva, Nataraja, Shankara,Bholenath, Rudra,Neelkanth, Trinetra, Pashupati, and Ardhanarishvara.
what is python?: Python is a popular, high-level, interpreted programming language known for its simplicity and readability.
how to install python?: Download Python from python.org and follow the installation instructions for your operating system.
how to print in python?:
Use the print() function. Example:
print('Hello World')
what is a list comprehension?:
List comprehensions provide a concise way to create lists. Example:
squares = [x*x for x in range(5)]
how to import a module?:
Use the import statement. Example:
import math
what is pip?:
pip is the package installer for Python. Example:
pip install package_name
how to read a file in python?:
Use open() to read files. Example:
with open('file.txt', 'r') as f:
    content = f.read()
how to write to a file?:
Use open() with 'w' mode and write(). Example:
with open('file.txt', 'w') as f:
    f.write('text')
what is a lambda function?:
A lambda function is an anonymous function. Example:
sum = lambda x, y: x + y
what is inheritance?:
Inheritance allows a class to inherit attributes and methods from another class. Example:
class Animal: pass
class Dog(Animal): pass
how to install numpy?: Use pip install numpy to install the numpy package.
what is a tuple?:
A tuple is an immutable sequence type. Example:
t = (1, 2, 3)
how to reverse a list?:
Use list.reverse() or list[::-1]. Example:
numbers = [1,2,3]; numbers.reverse()
how to sort a list?:
Use list.sort() or sorted(list). Example:
numbers = [3,1,2]; numbers.sort()
what is a set?:
A set is an unordered collection of unique elements. Example:
s = {1, 2, 3}
how to remove duplicates from a list?:
Convert the list to a set: list(set(my_list)). Example:
unique = list(set([1,2,2,3]))
how to get user input?:
Use input() function. Example:
name = input('Enter your name: ')
how to use map()?:
map() applies a function to all items in an iterable. Example:
list(map(str, [1,2,3]))
how to use filter()?:
filter() filters items in an iterable. Example:
list(filter(lambda x: x>0, [1,-1,2]))
how to use reduce()?:
reduce() applies a rolling computation. Example:
from functools import reduce
reduce(lambda x,y: x+y, [1,2,3])
what is a generator?:
A generator yields items one at a time using yield keyword. Example:
def gen():
    yield 1
    yield 2
how to check if a key exists in a dictio:
Use 'key' in dict. Example:
if 'a' in d:
how to iterate over a dictionary?:
Use for k, v in dict.items(). Example:
for k, v in d.items(): print(k, v)
how to format strings?:
Use f-strings: f'Hello {name}'. Example:
name = 'Ayush'; print(f'Hello {name}')
how to plot a graph in python?:
Use matplotlib.pyplot.plot(). Example:
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
plt.plot([1,2,3],[4,5,6])
plt.show()
how to create an object?:
Instantiate the class. Example:
obj = MyClass()
how to delete a file?:
Use os.remove('filename'). Example:
import os; os.remove('file.txt')
how to get current working directory?:
Use os.getcwd(). Example:
import os; print(os.getcwd())
how to check if file exists?:
Use os.path.exists('filename'). Example:
import os; os.path.exists('file.txt')
how to raise an exception?:
Use raise Exception('message'). Example:
raise ValueError('Invalid value')
how to define a constant?:
Use uppercase variable names by convention. Example:
PI = 3.14
how to use enumerate()?:
enumerate() gives index and value. Example:
for i, v in enumerate(['a','b']): print(i, v)
how to zip lists?:
Use zip(list1, list2). Example:
for a, b in zip([1,2],[3,4]): print(a, b)
how to unpack tuples?:
Use a, b = (1, 2). Example:
a, b = (1, 2)
how to use *args and **kwargs?:
*args for variable arguments, **kwargs for keyword arguments. Example:
def foo(*args, **kwargs): pass
how to convert string to list?:
Use list('string') or split(). Example:
list('abc'), 'a b c'.split()
how to use random module?:
import random; random.randint(1,10). Example:
import random; print(random.randint(1,10))
how to shuffle a list?:
Use random.shuffle(list). Example:
import random; random.shuffle(my_list)
how to use time.sleep()?:
import time; time.sleep(seconds). Example:
import time; time.sleep(2)
how to get current time?:
Use time.time() or datetime.datetime.now(). Example:
import time; print(time.time())
how to use datetime module?:
import datetime; datetime.datetime.now(). Example:
import datetime; print(datetime.datetime.now())
how to create a GUI in python?:
Use tkinter. Example:
import tkinter as tk
root = tk.Tk()
root.mainloop()
how to read a text file?: Use open() with read(). Example:\nwith open('data.txt','r') as f:\n    content = f.read()
how to write to a text file?: Use open() with write(). Example:\nwith open('out.txt','w') as f:\n    f.write('hello')
how to append to a text file?:
Use open() with 'a' mode. Example:
with open('log.txt','a') as f:
    f.write('new line
')
how to read file line by line?:
Iterate over file object. Example:
with open('data.txt') as f:
    for line in f:
        print(line.strip())
how to remove item from list?: Use remove() or pop(). Example:\nnums.remove(2); x = nums.pop()
how to loop over dict items?: Use dict.items(). Example:\nfor k, v in user.items():\n    print(k, v)
how to check key exists in dict?: Use 'in' operator. Example:\nif 'age' in user: print('ok')
how to define a function?: Use def keyword. Example:\ndef add(a, b):\n    return a + b
how to add default parameter?: Assign default in signature. Example:\ndef greet(name='World'):\n    print('Hello', name)
how to write lambda function?: Use lambda keyword. Example:\ndouble = lambda x: x * 2
how to document a function?: Use docstring. Example:\ndef f():\n    """This does something"""
how to use for loop?: Loop over iterable. Example:\nfor x in [1, 2, 3]:\n    print(x)
how to use while loop?: Loop with condition. Example:\nwhile n > 0:\n    n -= 1
how to break a loop?: Use break statement. Example:\nfor x in nums:\n    if x == 3: break
how to loop with index?: Use enumerate(). Example:\nfor i, v in enumerate(nums):\n    print(i, v)
how to import specific function?: Use from ... import. Example:\nfrom math import sqrt
how to install external package?: Use pip in terminal. Example:\npip install requests

obj = MyClass()
delete a file:
Use os.remove('filename'). Example:
import os; os.remove('file.txt')
get current working directory:
Use os.getcwd(). Example:
import os; print(os.getcwd())
check if file exists:
Use os.path.exists('filename'). Example:
import os; os.path.exists('file.txt')
raise an exception:
Use raise Exception('message'). Example:
raise ValueError('Invalid value')
define a constant:
Use uppercase variable names by convention. Example:
PI = 3.14
use enumerate():
enumerate() gives index and value. Example:
for i, v in enumerate(['a','b']): print(i, v)
zip lists:
Use zip(list1, list2). Example:
for a, b in zip([1,2],[3,4]): print(a, b)
unpack tuples:
Use a, b = (1, 2). Example:
a, b = (1, 2)
use *args and **kwargs:
*args for variable arguments, **kwargs for keyword arguments. Example:
def foo(*args, **kwargs): pass
convert string to list:
Use list('string') or split(). Example:
list('abc'), 'a b c'.split()
use random module:
import random; random.randint(1,10). Example:
import random; print(random.randint(1,10))
shuffle a list:
Use random.shuffle(list). Example:
import random; random.shuffle(my_list)
use time.sleep():
import time; time.sleep(seconds). Example:
import time; time.sleep(2)
get current time:
Use time.time() or datetime.datetime.now(). Example:
import time; print(time.time())
use datetime module:
import datetime; datetime.datetime.now(). Example:
import datetime; print(datetime.datetime.now())
create a GUI in python:
Use tkinter. Example:
import tkinter as tk
root = tk.Tk()
root.mainloop()
read a text file: Use open() with read(). Example:\nwith open('data.txt','r') as f:\n    content = f.read()
write to a text file: Use open() with write(). Example:\nwith open('out.txt','w') as f:\n    f.write('hello')
append to a text file:
Use open() with 'a' mode. Example:
with open('log.txt','a') as f:
    f.write('new line
')
read file line by line:
Iterate over file object. Example:
with open('data.txt') as f:
    for line in f:
        print(line.strip())
remove item from list: Use remove() or pop(). Example:\nnums.remove(2); x = nums.pop()
loop over dict items: Use dict.items(). Example:\nfor k, v in user.items():\n    print(k, v)
check key exists in dict: Use 'in' operator. Example:\nif 'age' in user: print('ok')
define a function: Use def keyword. Example:\ndef add(a, b):\n    return a + b
add default parameter: Assign default in signature. Example:\ndef greet(name='World'):\n    print('Hello', name)
write lambda function: Use lambda keyword. Example:\ndouble = lambda x: x * 2
document a function: Use docstring. Example:\ndef f():\n    """This does something"""
use for loop: Loop over iterable. Example:\nfor x in [1, 2, 3]:\n    print(x)
use while loop: Loop with condition. Example:\nwhile n > 0:\n    n -= 1
break a loop: Use break statement. Example:\nfor x in nums:\n    if x == 3: break
loop with index: Use enumerate(). Example:\nfor i, v in enumerate(nums):\n    print(i, v)
import specific function: Use from ... import. Example:\nfrom math import sqrt
install external package: Use pip in terminal. Example:\npip install requests
do you work: I work by processing your questions and providing answers based on my programming and the data I have been trained on.
do u feel: I don't have feelings, but I'm here to help you with any questions you have!
to help you: You can help me by asking clear and specific questions so I can provide the best possible answers.
to use you: You can use me by typing or speaking your questions, and I will do my best to provide accurate and helpful responses.
to talk to you: You can talk to me by typing your questions or using voice commands if supported.
to ask questions: You can ask questions by typing them out clearly or speaking them if voice input is available.
to import a module?:
Use the import statement. Example:
import math
to read a file in python?:
Use open() to read files. Example:
with open('file.txt', 'r') as f:
    content = f.read()
to write to a file?:
Use open() with 'w' mode and write(). Example:
with open('file.txt', 'w') as f:
    f.write('text')
to install numpy?: Use pip install numpy to install the numpy package.
to reverse a list?:
Use list.reverse() or list[::-1]. Example:
numbers = [1,2,3]; numbers.reverse()
to sort a list?:
Use list.sort() or sorted(list). Example:
numbers = [3,1,2]; numbers.sort()
to remove duplicates from a list?:
Convert the list to a set: list(set(my_list)). Example:
unique = list(set([1,2,2,3]))
to get user input?:
Use input() function. Example:
name = input('Enter your name: ')
to use map()?:
map() applies a function to all items in an iterable. Example:
list(map(str, [1,2,3]))
to use filter()?:
filter() filters items in an iterable. Example:
list(filter(lambda x: x>0, [1,-1,2]))
to use reduce()?:
reduce() applies a rolling computation. Example:
from functools import reduce
reduce(lambda x,y: x+y, [1,2,3])
to check if a key exists in a dictionary:
Use 'key' in dict. Example:
if 'a' in d:
to iterate over a dictionary?:
Use for k, v in dict.items(). Example:
for k, v in d.items(): print(k, v)
to format strings?:
Use f-strings: f'Hello {name}'. Example:
name = 'Ayush'; print(f'Hello {name}')
to plot a graph in python?:
Use matplotlib.pyplot.plot(). Example:
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
plt.plot([1,2,3],[4,5,6])
plt.show()
to create an object?:
Instantiate the class. Example:
obj = MyClass()
